instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2796: What is 820-2796? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA 11" 2010 - panic.
threads.message:
not liquid damage. board has no sign of liquid damage under a microscope.
board boot but kernel panic text messages before can load OSX any further.
ASD EFI passed everything but wont run memory test.

dead rams? can it be bios ?

i've already tried out of the case without airport card, ssd, trackpad etc..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA 11" 2010 - panic.
threads.message: Not worth bothering with as it could be anything, sorry.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA 11" 2010 - panic.
threads.message: duke, I found a liquid damage board, never been repair for Â£25. worth a shot repair and placing this into the case? if fixed, can i swap the bios chip to keep the old serial no.?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA 11" 2010 - panic.
threads.message: You can swap BIOSes on these without issue. If you want to play the Ebay garbage roulette then that is up to you, I wouldn't on a 7! year old machine.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA 11" 2010 - panic.
threads.message:
i received the ebay board but have no trackpad/keyboard.

ASD passed all test.


J5600
i have correct voltage on pin1 and pin10

diode mode:

pin 5 - <SIGNAL>USB_TPAD_CONN_P</SIGNAL> - 0.700 (should be 0.922)
pin 6 - <SIGNAL>USB_TPAD_CONN_N</SIGNAL> - 0.676 (good)


so dead PCH.




i've removed L5710 then run wires on <SIGNAL>USB_TPAD_CONN_P</SIGNAL> to right usb port:

<SIGNAL>USB_TPAD_CONN_P</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>USB_LT1_P</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>USB_TPAD_CONN_N</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>USB_LT1_N</SIGNAL>



now i have full working trackpad / keyboard, waking also work.

but when i insert a usb device into the slot, no device show up. ( i knew this will likely to happen )

is it possible connect to a hub (like BT Hub) so i can get back the right usb port working?


solution tested working, i'll make it nicer later. [IMG type="full" width="200px"]https://cl.ly/0L2D1b3T1b0G/download/20170609_135227.jpg[/IMG]
    [IMG type="full" width="1200px"]https://cl.ly/1i2Z302U421L/download/20170609_134443.jpg[/IMG]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA 11" 2010 - panic.
threads.message: There are 3 unused USB ports on the MCP. Check the board view if any can be accessed through test points.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA 11" 2010 - panic.
threads.message: no test points. guess have to live with 1 usb port.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA 11" 2010 - panic.
threads.message: You can choose between no BT or 1 USB port then.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA 11" 2010 - panic.
threads.message:
yeah fuk BT, who will use it on a vintage MBA.


is it ok to connect <SIGNAL>USB_TPAD_CONN_P</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>USB_BT_P</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>USB_TPAD_CONN_N</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>USB_BT_N</SIGNAL> test points?

it doesnt have inductor like <SIGNAL>USB_LT1_P</SIGNAL> have "L4600" or original L5710.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA 11" 2010 - panic.
threads.message: Inductor is not critical. The traces to the BT connector should of course be cut.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA 11" 2010 - panic.
threads.message: that will be difficult. i think i'll just to mask out the airport card's pin with a kapton tape. i've already swapped the bios chip. will try masking out these two bt pin tomorrow. NN

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2796</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MBA 11" 2010 - panic.
threads.message: mark this as SOLVED.....well by replacing with another board hahaha..
